architectural_notes: Investigate persistent slow connection establishment to backend despite good network (possible client agent config, repeated identity/auth flows, inefficient initialization, or backend call latency).
known_issues: App is slow every time when establishing connection to backend; user reports network is good and requests code review for performance regression.

existing_features.title: Fix the frontend backend-readiness polling so it does not continuously reset and re-poll due to state changes, and so it performs bounded exponential backoff until readiness is confirmed.
Reduce unnecessary query invalidation/refetch storms when the actor is created/changes, to avoid repeated backend calls that can make the app feel like it is re-connecting on every interaction.
Add explicit client-side performance instrumentation for actor creation and backend readiness (isReady) so slow connection setup can be diagnosed from the browser when the debug flag is enabled.

projectName: Investigate and fix persistent slow backend connection by stabilizing readiness polling and query refetch behavior
